00023 void Store2D::SetParameters( Parameters& MyParameters )
00024 {
00025   std::vector<double> ReturnedParamsDouble1, ReturnedParamsDouble2;
00026   std::list<std::string> ReturnedParamsString;  
00027 
00028   // First, get the details from the parameters object
00029   double min1, max1, min2, max2;
00030   long size1, size2;
00031   ReturnedParamsDouble1 = MyParameters.GetParametersDouble( "@storedim1" );
00032   if ( ReturnedParamsDouble1.size() < 3 )
00033     std::cerr << "Error with @storedim1" << std::endl;
00034   ReturnedParamsDouble2 = MyParameters.GetParametersDouble( "@storedim2" );
00035   if ( ReturnedParamsDouble2.size() < 3 )
00036     std::cerr << "Error with @storedim2" << std::endl;
00037   size1 = long(ReturnedParamsDouble1.at(2)+0.5);
00038   size2 = long(ReturnedParamsDouble2[2]+0.5);
00039   min1 = ReturnedParamsDouble1[0];
00040   min2 = ReturnedParamsDouble2[0];
00041   max1 = ReturnedParamsDouble1[1];
00042   max2 = ReturnedParamsDouble2[1];
00043 
00044   SetSize( size1, size2, 1 );
00045   SetLimitsDim1( ReturnedParamsDouble1[0], ReturnedParamsDouble1[1] );
00046   SetLimitsDim2( ReturnedParamsDouble2[0], ReturnedParamsDouble2[1] );
00047 }

00049 int Store2D::SetSize( long Size1_, long Size2_, long SizePerPoint_ )
00050 {
00051   SizeDim1 = Size1_;
00052   SizeDim2 = Size2_;
00053   SizePerPoint = SizePerPoint_;
00054 
00055   stats.resize( boost::extents[ (SizeDim1+1)*(SizeDim2+1) ][SizePerPoint] );
00056 
00057   // We want to set up all the StatisticsMC as pointers to
00058   // ConvergenceTable objects containing StatisticsMean objects
00059   StatisticsMean gatherer;
00060   ConvergenceTable tab(gatherer);
00061 
00062   for (long i=0; i!=(SizeDim1+1)*(SizeDim2+1); ++i)
00063     for (long opac=0; opac!=SizePerPoint; ++opac)
00064       stats[i][opac] = tab;
00065 
00066   return 0;
00067 }

00069 void Store2D::SetLimitsDim1( double MinDim1_, double MaxDim1_ )
00070 {
00071   MinDim1 = MinDim1_;
00072   MaxDim1 = MaxDim1_;
00073   // For convenience, we calculate the fixed step size and store it
00074   StepDim1 = (MaxDim1-MinDim1)/double(SizeDim1);
00075 }
00076 
00077 void Store2D::SetLimitsDim2( double MinDim2_, double MaxDim2_ )
00078 {
00079   MinDim2 = MinDim2_;
00080   MaxDim2 = MaxDim2_;
00081   // For convenience, we calculate the fixed step size and store it
00082   StepDim2 = (MaxDim2_-MinDim2_)/static_cast<double>(SizeDim2);
00083 }

00085 void Store2D::AddPoint( long IndexDim1_, long IndexDim2_, MyArray& Values_ )
00086 {
00087   for (long i=0; i<SizePerPoint; ++i)
00088     stats[GetIndex( IndexDim1_, IndexDim2_ )][i]->AddOneResult( Values_[i] );
00089 }

00091 long Store2D::GetNumIterations( long opac, long kth, long xth )
00092 {
00093   std::vector<std::vector<double> > res = 
00094         stats[GetIndex( kth, xth )][opac]->GetResultsSoFar();
00095   
00096   std::vector<std::vector<double> >::iterator it;
00097   it = res.end(); --it;
00098   return static_cast<long>( it->at(2) );
00099 }

00101 int Store2D::ReadFromFile( std::string FileName_ )
00102 {
00103   // Reading in a file, and putting it in the store
00104   // The code here is very similar to that in the parameters.cpp for reading
00105   // in the parameters from a file
00106 
00107   // First, we open the file and check that it exists
00108   std::ifstream FileIn;
00109   FileIn.open( FileName_.c_str(), std::ios::in );
00110   if ( FileIn.fail() )
00111   {
00112     std::cerr << "Store2D, unable to open file " << FileName_;
00113     std::cerr << " for reading." << std::endl;
00114     return -20;
00115   }
00116 
00117   // Each line, we'll read into LineReadIn
00118   // Each line of settings will be counted in NumberOfLines
00119   std::string LineReadIn;
00120 
00121   // Ok, we have an open file, we want to find the data section
00122   // The string that identifies the beginning of the settings section
00123   std::string BeginString = "# Begin Store2D data";
00124   // The string that identifies the end of the settings section
00125   std::string EndString = "# End Store2D data";
00126 
00127   // Indicator whether we have found the settings section yet
00128   bool FoundStart;
00129   // Run through the file until we find the settings section
00130   do
00131   {
00132     if ( FileIn.eof() )
00133     {
00134       std::cerr << "Store2D, reached end of file at line before "; 
00135       std::cerr << "finding data section" << std::endl;
00136       return -21;
00137     }
00138     getline( FileIn, LineReadIn );
00139     boost::trim( LineReadIn );
00140     if ( LineReadIn == BeginString )
00141       FoundStart = true;
00142   }
00143   while ( !FoundStart );
00144 
00145   // Now, pass off the logic to the >> operator
00146   FileIn >> *this;
00147 
00148   // Now we're done, we close the file
00149   FileIn.close();
00150   
00151   // Everything has worked fine. 
00152   // Return a success code
00153   return 0;
00154 }

00156 void Store2D::WriteToFile( std::string FileName_, bool append )
00157 {
00158   // First, open the file
00159   std::ofstream FileOut;
00160   if ( append )
00161   {
00162     FileOut.open( FileName_.c_str(), std::ios::app );
00163   }
00164   else
00165   {
00166     FileOut.open( FileName_.c_str(), std::ios::trunc );
00167   }
00168   
00169   // Check for errors
00170   if ( FileOut.fail() )
00171   {
00172     std::cerr << "Store2D, unable to open file " << FileName_;
00173     std::cerr << " for writing." << std::endl;
00174   }
00175 
00176   FileOut << "# Begin Store2D data" << std::endl;
00177   FileOut << *this;
00178   FileOut << "# End Store2D data" << std::endl;
00179   FileOut.close();
00180 }

00182 std::ostream& operator<<( std::ostream& out, const Store2D& store )
00183 {
00184   // Assume that all the preliminaries have been written
00185   // All we have to do here is write the data to file / stream
00186 
00187   // Format: dim1 dim2 results....
00188   // Incrementing dim1, then dim2
00189   
00190   // If there are multiple data sets per point, output one whole set then the next
00191   // Hence, outer iteration is over data sets per point
00192   for (long i=0; i<store.SizePerPoint; ++i)
00193   {
00194     // Inner iteration over all points
00195     for (long dim2=0; dim2<store.SizeDim2; ++dim2)
00196     {
00197       for (long dim1=0; dim1<store.SizeDim1; ++dim1)
00198       {
00199         // First, write the k, x coords to file
00200         // (for ease of reading either manually or by eg Mathematica)
00201         out << store.GetCoordDim1( dim1 ) << " " << store.GetCoordDim2( dim2 ) << " ";
00202         // Pass off the logic of writing to the ConvergenceTable object
00203         const ConvergenceTable* conTab = static_cast<const ConvergenceTable*>
00204                  ( store.stats[ store.GetIndex( dim1, dim2 ) ][i].GetConstPointer() );
00205         out << *conTab;
00206         out << std::endl;
00207       }
00208     }
00209   }
00210 
00211   // We're done, all overloading of << has to return the supplied ostream
00212   return ( out );
00213 }
00214 
00215 std::istream& operator>>( std::istream& in, Store2D& store )
00216 {
00217   // TODO: improve this to handle possible alterations to the file
00218   // eg blank lines, comment lines etc, handle errors and bad files properly
00219 
00220   double coordDim1, coordDim2;
00221   // Hence, outer iteration is over data sets per point
00222   for (long i=0; i<store.SizePerPoint; ++i)
00223   {
00224     // Inner iteration over all points
00225     for (long dim2=0; dim2<store.SizeDim2; ++dim2)
00226     {
00227       for (long dim1=0; dim1<store.SizeDim1; ++dim1)
00228       {
00229         // First, we have the coords in dim1 and dim2
00230         in >> coordDim1 >> coordDim2;
00231         // Pass off the logic of reading to the ConvergenceTable object
00232         ConvergenceTable* conTab = static_cast<ConvergenceTable*>
00233                  ( store.stats[ store.GetIndex( dim1, dim2 ) ][i].GetPointer() );
00234         in >> *conTab;
00235       }
00236     }
00237   }
00238 
00239   return ( in );
00240 }
